title: Authors and Citation
text: George Arthur. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Arthur G (2025). twbparser: Parse Tableau TWB/TWBX Workbooks. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://PrigasG.github.io/twbparser.
code: @Manual{,   title = {twbparser: Parse Tableau TWB/TWBX Workbooks},   author = {George Arthur},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://PrigasG.github.io/twbparser}, }

title: twbparser
text: [![License: MIT][](LICENSE.md) Parse Tableau TWB/TWBX files R: extract datasources, joins, relationships, fields, calculated fields, plus inspect unpack TWBX assets. Built large workbooks Shiny integration.

title: twbparser
text: TWB/TWBX: open packaged workbooks auto‑extract largest .twb Relationships & joins: parse legacy joins modern (2020.2+) relationships Calculated fields / parameters: list formulas, datatypes, roles, parameter metadata Datasources: connection classes/targets, inferred locations, field counts Dependency graph: build/plot field dependency DAGs TWBX assets: list/extract images, extracts, text files, etc.

title: twbparser
code: # Install from GitHub (using pak) install.packages("pak") pak::pak("PrigasG/twbparser")  # Or using devtools install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("PrigasG/twbparser")

title: twbparser
text: Parse “.twb” file Parse “.twbx” file graph objects (via igraph ggraph) visualization:
code: library(twbparser)  # Parse workbook parser <- TWBParser$new("path/to/workbook.twb")  # Extract calculated fields calc_fields <- parser$get_calculated_fields()  # View dependencies deps <- parser$get_field_dependencies()  # Generate DAG dag <- parser$generate_dag() parser <- TWBParser$new("path/to/workbook.twbx")  # Inspect manifest parser$twbx_manifest  # Extract data sources sources <- parser$get_datasource_details() Rscript -e "twbparser::parse_twb('my_dashboard.twb', output_dir = 'results/')"

title: twbparser
text: R Shiny: Build interactive dashboard showing calculations, filters, DAG visualizations. Power BI: Export calculated field logic replicate measures DAX. Data lineage: Combine DiagrammeR visNetwork workflow diagrams.

title: twbparser
text: Fork repo Create feature branch (git checkout -b feature/new-feature) Commit changes (git commit -m ‘Add new feature’) Push branch (git push origin feature/new-feature) Open Pull Request

title: twbparser
text: package licensed MIT License — see LICENSE file details.

title: Tableau Workbook Parser (R6) — TwbParser
text: Initialize parser .twb .twbx path. Return TWBX manifest (available). Return TWBX extract entries. Return TWBX image entries. Extract files TWBX disk. Validate relationships; optionally stop failure. Print one‑line summary parsed content.

title: Tableau Workbook Parser (R6) — TwbParser
text: R6 class generator.

title: Tableau Workbook Parser (R6) — TwbParser
text: path Path .twb .twbx file. types Optional vector types (e.g., "image", "extract"). pattern Optional regex match archive paths. files Optional explicit archive paths extract. exdir Output directory (defaults parser's twbx dir tempdir()). error TRUE, stop() validation fails.

title: Tableau Workbook Parser (R6) — TwbParser
text: Create parser Tableau .twb / .twbx files. initialization, parser reads XML precomputes relationships, joins, fields, calculated fields, inferred relationships, datasource details. .twbx, also extracts largest .twb records manifest.

title: Tableau Workbook Parser (R6) — TwbParser
text: path Path .twb .twbx disk. xml_doc Parsed xml2 document workbook. twbx_path Original .twbx path (packaged). twbx_dir Directory .twbx extracted. twbx_manifest Tibble .twbx contents. relations Tibble <relation> nodes. joins Tibble join clauses. relationships Modern relationships tibble. inferred_relationships Inferred pairs name/role. datasource_details List data_sources, parameters, all_sources. fields Tibble raw fields table info. calculated_fields Tibble calculated fields. last_validation List ok/issues validate().

title: Tableau Workbook Parser (R6) — TwbParser
text: new(path) Create parser .twb .twbx. get_twbx_manifest() Return .twbx manifest tibble. get_twbx_extracts() Return .twbx extract entries. get_twbx_images() Return .twbx image entries. extract_twbx_assets(types, pattern, files, exdir) Extract files .twbx. get_relations() Return relations tibble. get_joins() Return joins tibble. get_relationships() Return modern relationships tibble. get_inferred_relationships() Return inferred relationship pairs. get_datasources() Return datasource details tibble. get_parameters() Return parameters tibble. get_datasources_all() Return sources tibble. get_fields() Return raw fields tibble. get_calculated_fields() Return calculated fields tibble. validate(error = FALSE) Validate relationships (stop error = TRUE). summary() Print brief summary console.

what: Extract calculated fields from a TWB — extract_calculated_fields
title: Extract calculated fields from a TWB — extract_calculated_fields
text: Finds columns contain <calculation> nodes returns metadata formulas, heuristic flag table calculations.

Extract calculated fields from a TWB — extract_calculated_fields
text: xml_doc xml2 document Tableau .twb.

title: Extract calculated fields from a TWB — extract_calculated_fields
text: tibble columns: datasource Datasource name. name User-visible caption cleaned internal name. tableau_internal_name Internal Tableau name (often bracketed). datatype Tableau datatype. role Tableau role. formula Calculation formula string. class Tableau calc class (often "tableau"). is_table_calc Heuristic flag table calcs (e.g., WINDOW_, LOOKUP). table Raw table reference. table_clean Cleaned table name.

title: Extract calculated fields from a TWB — extract_calculated_fields

what: Extract columns with their source tables from a TWB — extract_columns_with_table_source
title: Extract columns with their source tables from a TWB — extract_columns_with_table_source
text: Scans top-level <datasource> nodes (excluding view-specific references) returns fields raw names/captions, cleaned table/field names, basic metadata.

title: Extract columns with their source tables from a TWB — extract_columns_with_table_source
Extract columns with their source tables from a TWB — extract_columns_with_table_source
text: xml_doc xml2 document Tableau .twb.

title: Extract columns with their source tables from a TWB — extract_columns_with_table_source
text: tibble columns: datasource Datasource name. name Raw column name (may include brackets/qualifiers). caption Column caption present. datatype Tableau datatype. role Tableau role. semantic_role Semantic role present. table Raw table reference. table_clean Cleaned table name (brackets/suffix). field_clean Cleaned field name.

title: Extract columns with their source tables from a TWB — extract_columns_with_table_source

what: Extract datasource details from a Tableau TWB — extract_datasource_details
title: Extract datasource details from a Tableau TWB — extract_datasource_details
text: Gathers runtime tables (object graph), merges named connection metadata (class, caption, targets), augments top-level datasource definitions (field counts, connection type, location). Also returns filtered table parameter datasources.

title: Extract datasource details from a Tableau TWB — extract_datasource_details
Extract datasource details from a Tableau TWB — extract_datasource_details
text: xml_doc xml2 document Tableau .twb.

title: Extract datasource details from a Tableau TWB — extract_datasource_details
text: named list : data_sources Tibble datasources joined connection metadata. parameters Tibble parameter datasources (present). all_sources data_sources (placeholder future variants).

title: Extract datasource details from a Tableau TWB — extract_datasource_details
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ xml <- xml2::read_xml("inst/extdata/sample.twb") out <- extract_datasource_details(xml) out$data_sources } # }

Extract modern relationships from a Tableau TWB — extract_relationships
text: xml_doc xml2 document Tableau .twb.

title: Extract modern relationships from a Tableau TWB — extract_relationships
text: tibble columns: relationship_type Always "Relationship" left_table Left table name right_table Right table name left_field Field name left side operator Join operator (e.g., "=") right_field Field name right side left_is_calc Logical, whether left field calculation right_is_calc Logical, whether right field calculation

title: Extract the .twb (and optionally all files) from a .twbx — extract_twb_from_twbx
code: extract_twb_from_twbx(   twbx_path,   extract_dir = file.path(tempdir(), paste0("twbx_",     tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(twbx_path)), "_", format(Sys.time(),     "%Y%m%d%H%M%S"))),   extract_all = FALSE )

title: Extract the .twb (and optionally all files) from a .twbx — extract_twb_from_twbx
text: twbx_path Path .twbx file. extract_dir Directory extract (defaults timestamped temp dir). extract_all TRUE, extract entire archive; otherwise largest .twb.

title: Extract the .twb (and optionally all files) from a .twbx — extract_twb_from_twbx
text: List twb_path, exdir, twbx_path, manifest (tibble).

what: Validate relationships against available datasources and fields — validate_relationships
title: Validate relationships against available datasources and fields — validate_relationships
text: Checks relationship endpoints reference known datasource tables predicate fields appear somewhere workbook (calculated, raw, parameter fields), using lenient token match (e.g., INT([GEOID]) → GEOID).

title: Validate relationships against available datasources and fields — validate_relationships
Validate relationships against available datasources and fields — validate_relationships
text: parser TwbParser-like object exposes: get_relationships(), get_datasources(), get_fields(), get_calculated_fields(). (S3/R6 fine.) strict Logical. Reserved future table‑scoped checks can overly conservative federated sources. Currently used.

title: Validate relationships against available datasources and fields — validate_relationships
text: list : ok TRUE issues; FALSE otherwise. issues named list tibbles. Possible elements: unknown_tables: endpoints found among known tables. unknown_fields: predicate fields found field pool.

title: Validate relationships against available datasources and fields — validate_relationships
